metadata.title: CVE-2019-17345 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen 4.8.x through 4.11.x allowing x86 PV guestOS users to cause a denial of service because mishandling of failed IOMMUoperations causes a bug check during the cleanup of a crashed guest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1t64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxendevicemodel1t64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxenevtchn1t64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxenforeignmemory1t64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxengnttab1t64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxenhypfs1t64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxenmisc4.17t64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxenstore4t64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxentoolcore1t64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
libxentoollog1t64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-amd64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-arm64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-armhf - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-system-armhf - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-utils-4.17 - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xen-utils-common - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
xenstore-utils - 4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.1+92-g6c33308a8d-1').
